data.title: MARY PUGH (PREECE/PRICE)
data.text: Mary Pugh was born at Llangunllo, Radnorshire (now Powys), Wales, the daughter of Evan Pugh and Jane Davis (or Davies). Llangunllo is a small rural town in Radnorshire, Wales, located 5½ miles west of the market town of Knighton and the English borders of Shropshire and Herefordshire. The Pugh family line has been traced back for at least two further generations to the small Welsh hamlet of Llanbister, located just seven miles to the west of Llangunllo. The surname of “Pugh” is believed to derive from a distant ancestor named Hugh whose children became known as “Ap Hugh” (“son or daughter of Hugh”). FIRST GENERATION MARY PUGH (PREECE/PRICE) (Mother of Ezekiel Price) It is believed that Mary was the oldest child in this family. The records indicate Mary was born on Christmas Day in 1793 and was christened 29 December in the parish church at Llangunllo. Other children born to Evan and Jane Pugh included Ann, christened 9 October 1796; Evan, christened 1 September 1799; Thomas, christened 23 May 1802; and John, christened 24 March 1805. In the distance is Knighton parish church where Mary Pugh married William Preece in 1824. On 21 June 1824, Mary married William Preece (also sometimes known 10
